page.title: 04Changes since the 1950's
page.content: We interviewed a local farmer who told us about his farm and the changes he had seen since the 1950's. The farm was built in the 1930's, originally as a hunting lodge. The farmer bought the land and the house in 1956 from a tenant farmer, who although of ninety years of age was most reluctant to leave the house and said "that if necessary he could farm from his bed!" The first major change was the arrival of electricity in the 1950's. Then in the 1960's came mains water and the end of the railway service to Cheltenham. This meant that the sheep were no longer taken from Andoversford by train. Also the fertiliser and corn seed for the land was collected from the railway station at Andoversford now had to be delivered from Gloucester by lorry.
